name: Media Type
description: The output device type.

valueDescriptions.description: Intended for paged material and for documents viewed on screen in print preview mode.
Intended primarily for color computer screens.

name: any-hover
description: Can the user hover over elements? This can match multiple queries.

valueDescriptions.description: Any input mechanism allows the user to hover over elements.
Any input mechanism does not allow the user to hover over elements.

name: any-pointer
description: Is there a pointing device? How accurate is it? This can match multiple queries.

valueDescriptions.description: Any input mechanism allows coarse positioning.
Any input mechanism allows fine positioning.
There is no pointing device.

name: aspect-ratio
description: The width-to-height aspect ratio of the viewport. This is converted to a decimal number, e.g. 16/9 becomes 1.77778.

name: color
description: Number of bits of color per color component.

valueDescriptions.description: The output device is not a color device.

name: color-gamut
description: Color range supported for output.

valueDescriptions.description: The display supports approximately the DCI-P3 gamut or more. p3 includes sRGB.
The display supports approximately the gamut specified by the ITU-R BT.2020 color space or more. rec2020 includes p3 and sRGB.
The display supports the sRGB gamut or more. This includes most displays.

name: color-index
description: Number of indexed colors for display.

valueDescriptions.description: The output device does not use an indexed color table.

name: device-aspect-ratio
description: DEPRECATED - Width-to-height aspect ratio of output.

name: device-height
description: DEPRECATED - Output device height.

name: device-posture
description: If viewport is flat or folded.

valueDescriptions.description: The device is flat or is unable to fold.
The device is folded.

name: device-width
description: DEPRECATED - Output device width.

name: display-mode
description: How the application is being displayed.

valueDescriptions.description: Opened in a conventional browser tab or new window.
Opened in a standalone window that takes over the entire screen and no user agent chrome is shown.
Looks and feels like a standalone application with a minimal set of UI elements for controlling navigation.
Displayed in a floating and always-on-top window.
Looks and feels like a standalone application.
Looks and feels like a standard desktop application.

name: dynamic-range
description: The combination of brightness, contrast ratio, and color depth.

valueDescriptions.description: The display and user agent support high peak brightness, high contrast ratio, and wide color gamut.
Matches any visual device. A device that matches high will also match standard.

name: forced-colors
description: Does the user agent restrict colors?

valueDescriptions.description: Forced color mode is active.
The page's colors are not forced into a limited palette.

name: grid
description: Does the device use a grid or a bitmap screen?

valueDescriptions.description: The device uses a bitmap screen.
The device uses a grid screen.

name: height
description: The output device height.

name: hover
description: Can the user hover over elements?

valueDescriptions.description: The primary input mechanism allows the user to hover over elements.
Hovering is not possible with the primary input mechanism.

name: inverted-colors
description: Is the user agent or OS inverting colors?

valueDescriptions.description: Colors are inverted.
Neither the OS nor the user agent are inverting colors.

name: monochrome
description: Bits per pixel in the device's monochrome frame buffer.

valueDescriptions.description: The device is not monochrome.

name: orientation
description: Viewport orientation.

valueDescriptions.description: The viewport is wider than it is tall.
The viewport is taller than it is wide.

name: overflow-block
description: How does the device handle overflows along the block axis?

valueDescriptions.description: Overflowing content is not displayed.
Content could be scrolled or page breaks can manually be triggered.
Content is broken up into discrete pages.
Content is scrollable when it overflows.

name: overflow-inline
description: Can content overflowing the inline axis be scrolled?

valueDescriptions.description: Overflowing content is not displayed.
Content is scrollable when it overflows.

name: pointer
description: Is the input a pointing device? How accurate is it?

valueDescriptions.description: The primary pointing device allows coarse positioning.
The primary pointing device allows fine positioning.
There is no pointing device.

name: prefers-color-scheme
description: Does the user prefer a light or dark color scheme?

valueDescriptions.description: The user prefers a dark color scheme.
The user prefers a light color scheme.

name: prefers-contrast
description: Did the user change the amount of contrast between adjacent colors?

valueDescriptions.description: The user has specified a specific set of colors. The colors do not fulfill more nor less.
Less contrast is desired.
The user has no preference for contrast.
More contrast is desired.

name: prefers-reduced-data
description: Has the user requested web content that consumes less bandwidth?

valueDescriptions.description: The user has no preference for reduced data usage.
The user prefers reduced data usage.

name: prefers-reduced-motion
description: Does the user prefer less motion?

valueDescriptions.description: The user has no preference for reduced motion.
The user prefers reduced motion.

name: prefers-reduced-transparency
description: Does the user want less transparency or translucent layer effects?

valueDescriptions.description: The user has no preference for reduced transparency.
The user prefers reduced transparency.

name: resolution
description: Output pixel density.

name: scan
description: Is the display progressive or interlaced?

valueDescriptions.description: The display is interlaced.
The display is progressive.

name: scripting
description: Is JavaScript enabled?

valueDescriptions.description: JavaScript is enabled.
JavaScript is enabled, but the user has requested that it be disabled after the initial page load.
JavaScript is disabled.

name: shape
description: Distinguish regular and round displays.

valueDescriptions.description: The display is rectangular.
The display is round.

name: update
description: How frequently can the device modify the appearance of content.

valueDescriptions.description: The device cannot modify the appearance of content, such as when it is printed on paper.
The device can modify the appearance of content, but it is slow, such as with an epaper display or severely underpowered device.
The device can modify the appearance of content quickly and animations could be used.

name: video-dynamic-range
description: Combination of brightness, contrast ratio, and color depth supported by video.

valueDescriptions.description: The video supports high peak brightness, high contrast ratio, and color depth greater than 24-bit (8-bits per color component of RGB).
Matches any visual device. A device that matches high will also match standard.

name: width
description: Width of the viewport, including scrollbar.
